snippet: Michael Hasenstab, whose Franklin Templeton Global Bond Fund owns billions in Irish and Hungarian bonds, is drawing comparisons to the giants of the mutual fund industry.
abstract: Michael Hasenstab, whose Franklin Templeton Global Bond Fund owns billions in Irish and Hungarian bonds, is betting on a recovery of two of Europe's most wounded countries; Hasenstab is making a name for himself as a fund manager who is not afraid to make big, concentrated bets in countries or currencies that others shy away from.

byline.original: By PETER EAVIS and JULIE CRESWELL

lead_paragraph: Michael Hasenstab, whose Franklin Templeton Global Bond Fund owns billions in Irish and Hungarian bonds, is drawing comparisons to the giants of the mutual fund industry.

headline.seo: A Contrarian Bets Ireland and Hungary Will Rebound
headline.main: A Contrarian Bets Ireland and Hungary Will Rebound
headline.print_headline: A Contrarian Bets Ireland and Hungary Will Rebound
